Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 02/27/2025, a youth was jumped by other youth at the facility
and sustained two black eyes. A staff member held the youth
down while they were being assaulted. The incident was not
reported to the youth's guardian.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 03/12/2025.
Complainant stated Youth A’s right eyelid was purple and the
surrounding area was yellow and green and the area below Youth
A’s left eye was yellow and green in color on 03/05/2025.
Youth A was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth A by face
time and then by phone when the face time call disconnected on
03/12/2025 because they currently reside as guests in someone’s
home, making it cumbersome to facilitate an in-person interview.
The interview was done jointly with Wayne County Juvenile
Detention Special Investigation Unit (SIU) Investigator. Youth A
stated she was at Wayne County Juvenile Detention from
02/19/2025 to 03/05/2025. Youth A stated she overheard Staff 1
speaking with Youth B, Youth C, Youth D and Youth E in Unit 2A’s
common area on 02/26/2025 about jumping Youth A when Youth
A was in the classroom with Youth F, Youth G, Youth H and
Teacher. Youth A stated Staff 1 asked Youth A to come out into
the common area. Youth A stated she asked Staff 1 to call a
supervisor and Staff 1 said, “Don’t tell me how to do my job.”
Youth A stated Teacher directed Youth A to sit down and stay in
the classroom. Youth A stated she walked out of the classroom
with Youth D and Youth H when Teacher left the classroom. Youth
A stated Youth B, Youth C, Youth D and Youth E “jumped” her in
2

the common area. Youth A stated Staff 1 stood behind Youth A,
held her arms and bent her forward allowing Youth D to kick Youth
A's face while Youth C and Youth E hit her. Youth A stated she
screamed for a supervisor and Youth G told Youth B, Youth C,
Youth D and Youth E to get off of Youth A. Youth A stated Youth
B, Youth C, Youth D and Youth E ran away from Youth A when
staff responded to the assistance call and the incident ended.
Youth A stated after the fight she saw a nurse for her eye injuries.
Youth A stated she requested and was transferred to Unit 2B
following the day of the fight. Youth A stated her eyes and the
scratch on her rib cage from this incident healed. Youth A denied
other injuries from this incident.
Youth B was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth B stated her best friend, Youth D,
told her that Youth A wanted to fight her, and Youth C told her the
same. Youth B stated she is “not much a talker” and asked Youth
A if she wanted to fight. Youth B stated Youth A said, “I don’t care”
and walked back to the classroom. Youth B stated Staff 1
overheard this and told Youth B to “leave it alone” because Youth
B had court coming up. Youth B stated she went to the classroom
and was not allowed in. Youth B stated Youth A later walked out
of the classroom and asked Youth B if she wanted to get “one on
one” (fight). Youth B stated she swung and it connected with
Youth A’s face and Youth A swung back. Youth B stated one of
Youth A’s swings scratched Youth B’s face and this caused Youth
C to swing at Youth A, Youth D to kick Youth A’s face and Youth E
to punch Youth A. Youth B stated Staff 1 tried to step between
Youth A and Youth B but Youth A and Youth B had each other by
the hair making it difficult for Staff 1 to intervene. Youth B stated
assistance staff came and separated Youth A and Youth B. Youth
B stated Youth A received a black eye from Youth D kicking her
face.
Youth C was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated Youth B is
her half-sister. Youth C stated Youth A is Caucasian and used
“nigga” to reference the other youths on the unit. Youth C stated a
staff (does not know her name) redirected Youth A’s language.
Youth C stated Youth B told Youth A that she was being racist but
Youth A said she did not care. Youth C stated Youth B swung first
and Youth A swung back. Youth C stated Youth D kicked Youth A
in the eye. Youth C stated she hit Youth A in the back one time.
Youth C stated staff responded to the assistance call and the
3

incident ended. Youth C stated Youth A obtained a black eye from
this incident.
Youth D was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth D’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth D on
04/08/2025 by phone. Youth D stated Youth A sneaked fake
eyelashes on to the unit in her vagina during a visit. Youth D
stated she told Youth A to stop talking about it and this upset
Youth A. Youth D stated Youth B, who is like a sister, was placed
on Unit 2A, and asked about her relationship with the youths.
Youth D stated Youth B learned that she did not get along with
Youth A and told her that she would take care of it. Youth D stated
the next day Youth B asked Youth A to fight. Youth D stated Youth
A agreed and headed back into the classroom to get other youths
to join. Youth D stated after class Youth A and Youth B fought.
Youth D stated Youth C and Youth E joined the fight and hit Youth
A. Youth D stated Staff 1, who was the only staff on the unit,
moved Youth D into a corner after Youth D hit Youth A’s head.
Youth D stated assistance staff responded and the incident
ended. Youth D stated Youth A had two black eyes from this
incident and transferred to another unit before leaving for home.
Youth E was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention
to an out of state placement. Information was provided to current
placement on 04/03/2025 to schedule a phone interview with
Youth E. Youth E’s current placement did not reach out with
approval and information to interview Youth E.
Youth F was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth F stated Youth A
and Youth D had an argument (does not know what it was about)
and this led to Youth A’s fight with Youth B. Youth F stated the
staff (does not recall her name) asked Youth A and Youth B to
stop name calling each other prior to their fight. Youth F stated
Youth B waited for Youth A to exit the classroom to swing and
Youth A swung back. Youth F stated Youth D kicked Youth A’s
head and Youth C tried to hit Youth A. Youth F stated she and
Youth G and Youth H did not participate in the fight. Youth F
stated the staff on the unit tried to move Youth B away from Youth
A during the fight. Youth F stated the incident ended when
assistance staff responded. Youth F stated Teacher left the unit
sometime during Youth A and Youth B’s fight.
Youth G was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth G stated she was
close to Youth A. Youth G stated Youth A and Youth D had an
4

argument (does not know what it was about) which caused
conflict. Youth G stated Youth B, who was new to the unit and
knew Youth D, told Youth D that she would handle Youth A. Youth
G stated the next day Youth C and Youth D left and returned to
the classroom and told Youth A there would be a fight because
Youth A “messed” with Youth D. Youth G stated Youth B came to
the classroom door and Youth A said, “I don’t know you. Why you
want to fight?” Youth G stated Youth B did not respond but once
class finished Youth A took off her socks to prepare for the fight.
Youth G stated Youth A asked Staff 1 to call for a supervisor and
Staff 1 said, “Don’t tell me how to do my job.” Youth G stated
Youth B ran up and fought Youth A outside the classroom. Youth
G stated she tried to get Youth B to let go of Youth A’s hair. Youth
G stated Youth D kicked Youth A and Youth E hit Youth A. Youth
G stated Staff 1 called for assistance and held Youth A from
behind. Youth G stated assistance staff came and the incident
ended. Youth G stated Youth A’s eye was swollen from this
incident and the nurse gave Youth A an ice pack.
Youth H was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth H’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth H by phone
on 04/09/2025. Youth H stated she heard Youth A call Youth D a
“nigga” and Youth D told Youth B as soon as Youth B was placed
on the unit. Youth H stated the next day Youth C entered the
classroom and said, “My sister want to fight you.” Youth H stated
Youth A asked Youth B the reason but does not recall the
response. Youth H stated Staff 1 unlocked the bathroom door for
Youth H and the fight between Youth A and Youth B, Youth C,
Youth D and Youth E started. Youth H stated Staff 1 ran back to
separate the youths fighting. Youth H stated Staff 1 tried to move
Youth B away from Youth A as Youth A hit Youth B. Youth H
stated Youth A was hit and kicked. Youth H stated assistance staff
came to the unit and the incident ended. Youth H stated Youth A
obtained a black eye and a scratch on her face from this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated she arrived
on Unit 2A to give another staff her break. Staff 1 stated she was
the only staff on the unit with eight youths. Staff 1 stated she
remained in the common area with four youths and Teacher had
four youths in the classroom. Staff 1 stated Youth C exited the
classroom and Youth A followed. Staff 1 stated she told Youth A
to stay by her because Youth C made instigating comments
earlier (does not recall the specifics). Staff 1 stated she does not
recall Youth A requesting Staff 1 to call a supervisor. Staff 1 stated
either Youth A or Youth B threw the first punch. Staff 1 stated she
5

tried to stand between Youth A and Youth B to keep them
separate but they held each other’s hair and other youths joined in
the fight. Staff 1 stated Youth D kicked Youth A’s face. Staff 1
stated assistance staff responded and the incident ended. Staff 1
stated Youth A saw Nurse for her eye injuries. Staff 1 denied
hearing Youth A use racial slurs but stated Youth C and Youth D
made that accusation. Staff 1 stated Youth A was transferred to
Unit 2B following this incident. Staff 1 stated she did not
encourage youths to fight Youth A and did not hold Youth A to
allow youths to hit Youth A.
Teacher was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
04/03/2025 with another DHHS Worker 3. Teacher stated he
asked the youths to remain in the classroom after the movie
because several youths were outside the classroom with a staff
(does not recall who) and it seemed contentious. Teacher stated
Youth A asked for a supervisor and he told the youths not to do
anything “crazy” as he packed up his belongings to go to his next
class on another unit. Teacher stated he was at the unit door
waiting to exit when Youth A and Youth B started to pull each
other’s hair. Teacher stated Youth G tried to help the staff, who
was separating Youth A and Youth B. Teacher stated assistance
was called and he left the unit when assistance staff arrived.
Teacher stated the staff immediately ran up to Youth A and Youth
B to intervene when the fight started. Teacher stated teachers are
trained in Handle with Care but help with securing the youths
away from the incident and do not engage in physical
management.
Supervisor was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
on 03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Supervisor stated she
responded to an assistance call and the incident was over when
she arrived. Supervisor stated Youth A stood by the unit’s
entrance door and told her someone kicked her face. Supervisor
stated Youth A’s face was not bruised at the time but she saw her
days later with facial swelling and discoloration.
Manager 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
on 03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Manager 1 stated she
responded to an assistance call but the incident ended when she
arrived. Manager 1 stated she was told (does not recall by whom)
Youth B started the fight and other youths joined in. Manager 1
stated Youth A was visibly upset with an eye injury. Manager 1
stated she does not recall Youth A making allegations about Staff
1’s response or role in the incident. Manager 1 stated Youth A
transferred from Unit 2A to Unit 2B following the incident. Manager
6

1 stated Teachers are trained in physical management but do not
assist staff (direct care workers) in physical management
situations.
Manager 3 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
on 03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Manager 3 did not
recall Youth A. Manager 3 stated Youth D was involved in
numerous physical altercations when told the incident involved
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D.
Nurse was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Nurse stated she did not
recall Youth A. Nurse reviewed Youth A’s 02/28/2025 progress
note and did not recall the incident. Nurse stated she must have
assessed Youth A as written in the progress note.
Video
Unit 2A 02/26/2025 on or around 08:43:22 video shows Youth A
and Youth B facing each other and engaged in a fight with
swinging and hair pulling in the common area. Staff 1 follows
Youth A and Youth B and tries to place her right arm between
them. Three youths join in and strike Youth A. One youth
approaches the fight and taps a youth on her upper arm and this
youth and another youth back away from Youth A. Meanwhile
Staff 1 stands next to Youth A with her right arm around Youth A’s
upper shoulders and looks like she attempts to move Youth A
away from Youth B. Staff 1 positions herself between Youth A and
Youth B, who holds Youth A on one side, and another youth holds
Youth A from the other side. Youth A appears to stand sideways
and bends forward as she is pulled on by the other youth. A youth
walks up and kicks Youth A. Staff 1’s back is to the video camera
and blocks the view of her actions but her backside is pressed
against Youth B’s frontside preventing Youth B from moving closer
towards Youth A. Youth A is released from Youth B and the other
youth and Staff 1 immediately stands with her back to Youth B
with her arms spread out to the side to prevent Youth B from
approaching Youth A on or around 08:44:37. Assistance staff
arrive on the unit on or around 08:44:40 and the incident ends.
Manager 1 and Youth A move away from the unit door and Youth
A sits down in a chair in front of the shower stalls. A youth
consoles Youth A with Manager 1 present. Youth A lifts her
sweatshirt up twice to look at the right side of her torso. Teacher
stood by the unit door, watched the fight and left after assistance
arrived on the unit.
Documentation
7

Staff 1 wrote an incident report about Youth A and Youth B’s fight
on 02/26/2025 at 8:40 AM on Unit 2A that matches her interview.
02/26/2025 Nursing Progress Note states Youth A was evaluated
after a fight with youths. Youth A complained of right eye pain with
blurry vision and denied dizziness. Youth A’s injuries are swollen
and bruised right eye, multiple superficial scratches on her right
flank and bruising on the left side of her forehead.
02/28/2025 Nursing Progress Note states Youth A re-evaluated
for right eye injury. Youth A’s vision is improving. Youth A denied
pain and need for medical treatment.
Another DHHS Worker interviewed Youth A in person on
03/07/2025 and took pictures. One picture shows Youth A with
bruising on her right eyelid and bruising on the outer corner of her
right eye and the area directly below her right eye. Another picture
shows Youth A with bruising in the area directly below her left eye.
The final picture shows Youth A with three round small, bruise
marks on her left leg below her kneecap towards the outer part of
her leg.
Another DHHS Worker requested on 03/07/2025 for Youth A’s
Mother to take Youth A for an evaluation. Youth A was seen at an
emergency department on 03/07/2025. Youth A was diagnosed
with multiple contusions, under her right eye, left lateral breast, left
lower leg and calf, right anterior shoulder and left lower back. It
was recommended for Youth A to follow up with her primary care
doctor.
Staff 1 last completed Handle with Care on 12/11/2024 and
12/12/2024.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s maximum waking hour ratio is
one staff to eight youths on Unit 2A.
Tour
Upon entering Unit 2A one steps on to the common area, which
has tables and couches. The staff desk is located near the front of
the common area. Two showers and a classroom are located to
the right of the unit door. Youth bedrooms surround the common
area to the left of the unit door.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance when Staff 1 intervened
between Youth A and Youth B’s fight and with other youths joining
the fight. It is not found that Staff 1 instigated the fight between
8

Youth A and Youth B. This incident does not require parental
notification based on R 400.4150 Incident reporting. (1) Any
incident resulting in serious injury of a resident or illness requiring
inpatient hospitalization, shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency and the licensing authority
as soon as possible but not more than 24 hours after the incident.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1
Two staff members are groping youth when they are patting them
down. One youth was molested by one of the staff members,
resulting in bruises on the youth’s breasts and thighs.
Allegation 2
Youth A’s stool was removed from her Unit 2A room 5 room.
Investigation Allegation 1
Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 03/12/2025.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth A by face
time and then by phone when the face time call disconnected on
03/12/2025 because they currently reside as guests in someone’s
home, making it cumbersome to facilitate an in-person interview.
The interview was done jointly with Wayne County Juvenile
Detention SIU Investigator. Youth A gave a description of male
staff with a job title that likely matches Manager 2. Youth A gave a
description of a female staff that “looks like a man”, who was not
identified. Youth A stated these two staff “groped and squeezed”
her during a pat down sometime in 02/2025 that resulted in a
9

bruise on her breast, thigh and lower back. Youth A stated she did
not recall the reason for the pat down. Youth A attended a KIDS
Talk on 04/18/2025. Taken from another DHHS Worker’s KIDS
Talk notes, Youth A identified Staff 3’s pat down causing a bruise
to her leg and breast and did not describe or state Manager 2
being involved in her pat down resulting in bruises.
Youth B and Youth F were interviewed separately at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention on 03/27/2025 with another DHHS
Worker. Youth B and Youth F stated female staff pat down female
youths. Youth F stated male staff complete the room and unit
searches for contraband on the female unit.
Youth G was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth G stated female
staff pat down female youths and male staff pat down male
youths.
Youth H was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth H’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth H by phone
on 04/09/2025. Youth H stated female staff always pat down
female youth. Youth H stated she did not have concerns with pat
downs.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated pat downs
occur during contraband searches. Staff 1 stated pat downs are
done by the same gender staff as the youth. Staff 1 stated a male
staff would never pat down a female youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
05/01/2025 upon returning from her personal leave. Staff 3 stated
she never completed a pat down on Youth A.
Supervisor and Manager 1 were interviewed separately at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention on 03/27/2025 with another
DHHS Worker. Supervisor and Manager 1 stated pat downs are
done by the same gender staff as the youth. Manager 1 stated pat
downs occur for newly admitted youths, during unit searches and
when youths leave and return to the unit.
Manager 2 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
on 03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Manager 2 stated
youths may receive a pat down during unit searches or when they
leave and return to the unit. Manager 2 stated all youth pat downs
10

are done by the same gender staff as the youth. Manager 2
denied patting down a female youth and does not recall Youth A.
Documentation
Another DHHS Worker requested on 03/07/2025 for Youth A’s
Mother to take Youth A for an evaluation. Youth A was seen at an
emergency department on 03/07/2025. Youth A was diagnosed
with multiple contusions, under her right eye, left lateral breast, left
lower leg and calf, right anterior shoulder and left lower back. It
was recommended for Youth A to follow up with her primary care
doctor.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility Searches policy and
procedure 10.5 states “Frisk (pat-down) searches shall always be
conducted by a JDS of the same gender.” It states, “If a resident
identifies his/herself as a gender of other than that which they
were born as, a medical staff person shall be present during any
search of a resident.”
Allegation 2
Youth A stated during her interview on 03/12/2025 that her Unit
2A room 5 stool was removed for reason unknown. This forced
Youth A to sit on her desk if she wanted to watch television when
inside her room.
Deputy Director was asked about the removal of Unit 2A room 5
stool. Deputy Director email dated 4/15/2025 stated the stool was
removed because it was loose (screws secure the stool to the
cement ground). The stool was reinstalled securely.
Analysis Allegation 1
The agency is found in compliance based on Youth A’s conflicting
account about Manager 2 patting her down while all other
interviews stated same gender staff complete a pat down of a
youth. Staff 3 denied performing a pat down on Youth A. It cannot
be determined if Youth A’s allegation of bruises to her breast,
thigh and back are from a pat down in 02/2025 or possibly from
the 02/26/2025 fight.
Allegation 2
The agency is found in compliance based on removing Unit 2A
room 5’s loose stool and then securely reinstalling the stool.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
11

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(b) Denial of any essential program service as punishment. These
include, but are not limited to, the following:
(ii) Family time or any type of communication with family.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When the youth disclosed information to their guardian at a visit,
minutes were taken away from the youth and they were unable to
use the phone.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 03/12/2025.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth A by face
time and then by phone when the face time call disconnected on
03/12/2025 because they currently reside as guests in someone’s
home, making it cumbersome to facilitate an in-person interview.
The interview was done jointly with Wayne County Juvenile
Detention SIU Investigator. Youth A stated she was not allowed to
call her mother following her fight with Youth B. Youth A stated
Staff 3 told her that her phone minutes were taken due to the fight.
Staff 3 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
05/1/2025 upon her return from personal leave. Staff 3 denied
threatening or taking away Youth A’s phone minutes.
Documentation
Youth A’s phone log was reviewed. Youth A and Youth B’s
physical altercation occurred on 02/26/2025. Youth A’s phone log
shows Youth A made the following calls to her mother.
• 02/27/2025 Youth A made two calls. One call at 15:44 for 3
minutes and 30 seconds and another call at 17:57 for 51
seconds.
• 02/28/2025 Youth A made one call at 15:57 for 5 minutes
and 15 seconds.
• 03/02/2025 Youth A made three calls. One call at 10:36 for
11 minutes and 48 seconds. Another call at 11:39 for 1
12

minute and 45 seconds. A third call at 17:03 for 2 minutes
and 34 seconds.
• 03/03/2025 Youth A made one call at 20:22 for 3 minutes
and 31 seconds.
• 03/04/2025 Youth A made three calls. One call at 15:36 for
43 seconds. Another call at 16:42 for 1 minute and 54
seconds. A third call at 18:39 for 6 minutes.
• 03/05/2025 Youth A discharged to her mother.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Youth A made multiple
phone calls to her mother following her 02/26/2025 physical
altercation with Youth B.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth's background or
appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff used racial slurs when speaking to the youth.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 03/12/2025.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A is discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth A by face
time and then by phone when the face time call disconnected on
03/12/2025 because they currently reside as guests in someone’s
home, making it cumbersome to facilitate an in-person interview.
The interview was done jointly with Wayne County Juvenile
Detention SIU Investigator. Youth A stated Staff 1 said, “White
people do not know how to act. They want to be black.”
13

Youth G was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker and Youth B and Youth
C were interviewed separately at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention on 03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth B,
Youth C and Youth G stated staff do not name call youths or make
derogatory comments.
Youth D and Youth H are discharged from Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth D’s Mother gave permission to interview
Youth D on 04/08/2025 by phone. Youth H’s Mother gave

Rule Code Staff to resident ratio.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall correspond with
Description the institution’s purpose and the needs of the residents and shall
assure the continual safety, protection and direct care and
supervision of residents.
Allegation Additional Finding
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was discharged from Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth A by face
time and then by phone when the face time call disconnected on
03/12/2025 because they currently reside as guests in someone’s
home, making it cumbersome to facilitate an in-person interview.
The interview was done jointly with Wayne County Juvenile
Detention SIU Investigator. Youth A stated she asked Staff 1 to
call a supervisor and Staff 1 said, “Don’t tell me how to do my job.”
Youth A stated Teacher directed her to stay in the classroom but
she left the classroom after the Teacher did and the fight between
Youth A and Youth B and other youths occurred.
Youth B was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth B stated Staff 1 overheard talk
about Youth A and Youth B fighting. Youth B stated Staff 1 told
Youth B to “leave it alone” because Youth B had court coming up.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/27/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated she arrived
on Unit 2A to give another staff her break. Staff 1 stated she was
the only staff on the unit with eight youths. Staff 1 stated she
remained in the common area with four youths and Teacher had
four youths in the classroom. Staff 1 stated she told Youth A to
stay by her when Youth A exited the classroom because Youth C
made instigating comments earlier (does not recall the specifics).
Staff 1 stated she does not recall Youth A requesting Staff 1 to call
a supervisor.
Teacher was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
04/03/2025 with another DHHS Worker 3. Teacher stated he
asked the youths to remain in the classroom after the movie
because several youths were outside the classroom with a staff
(does not recall who) and it seemed contentious. Teacher stated
19

Youth A asked for a supervisor and he told the youths not to do
anything “crazy” as he packed up his belongings for his next class.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s maximum waking hour ratio is
one staff to eight youths on Unit 2A.
Documentation
The agency’s policies and procedures indicate their ratio is 1 staff
to 8 youths (1:8).
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for having adequate staff
to youth ratio on 02/26/2025 to provide for the safety, protection,
direct care and supervision of Unit 2A youths based on the
following: 1) Youth B stated Staff 1 overhead talk about Youth A
and Youth B fighting. 2) Staff 1 stated she told Youth A to stay by
her because Youth C made instigating comments. 3) Teacher
stated it seemed contentious outside of the classroom and told the
youths inside the classroom to not do anything “crazy”. Given
these factors, Staff 1 should have called for a supervisor to
request and obtain additional staff. This would have aided in the
response time to stop the fight between Youth A and Youth B and
other youths. The agency’s ratio of 1:8 was insufficient to ensure
the safety and protection of youth in this incident.
CONSULTATION
Staff 1 does not recall Youth A asking for a supervisor. However,
when such requests are made, staff should inquire about the
reason and seek resolution when possible.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
